other_tests.findings: Severe dynamic left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) obstruction (85 mmHg at rest) and significant mitral valve systolic anterior motion resulting in moderate-to-severe mitral regurgitation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-surgical resting echocardiography demonstrated a significant reduction in LVOT gradient (now 5 mmHg).

other_tests.findings: Electrically and symptomatically negative for inducible ischaemia, but showed evidence of severe dynamic intracavity obstruction post-exercise and moderate-severe dynamic mitral regurgitation.
Demonstrated a large calibre first septal perforating artery extending to the endocardial border of the LVOT with probable communication with the LV cavity.
Confirmed a fistula between an unroofed first septal perforator and the LV cavity.
Demonstrated septal post-surgical wall motion changes and an ejection fraction (EF) of 59%, with no evidence of myocardial ischaemia.
Demonstrated incidental runs of asymptomatic non-sustained ventricular tachycardia.
